channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2025020056
item.description:
Report X-2025020056

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-05T03:26:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/17/2025 at approximately 0945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 2 fiberboard boxes, each containing 201 boxes of safety matches. The shipment was x-rayed and identified by Customs. It appears that the shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it seems to have shipped without the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2025011312
item.description:
Report X-2025011312

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/15/2025 at approximately 1130, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 326185 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one item labeled as a lithium battery pack. The shipment was labeled "lithium batteries contained in equipment" and displayed a partially obliterated Battery hazard label. Further inspection revealed that the commodity is a battery pack and was improperly classified. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it does not have required markings, labeling, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2025011244
item.description:
Report X-2025011244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENT WAS PERFORMING AN OBSERVATION OF OPERATIONS WHEN THEY FLAGGED A PACKAGE AS SUSPICIOUS AND REQUESTED CONTENT INSPECTION. THE PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED WITH BROWN KRAFT PAPER. ANCHORAGE UPS SECURITY LEAD OPENED THE PACKAGE FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A TOTAL OF SEVENTEEN CANISTERS OF #11 EXPLOSIVE PERCUSSION CAPS. THERE ARE ALSO FOUR PACKETS OF #11 REVOLVER NIPPLES AND ONE PAIR OF EQUATE +2.00 READER GLASSES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING.THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO ANC.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was denied clearance by US Customs. Customs brought package to the area that we dispose of packages. Before the package was disposed of it was discovered to have undecalred DG. The package was then brought to the DG area and is being held.
